Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: VEGA1 PLASMAG-1 PLASMA ENERGY ANALYSER DATA V1.0
Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Dyachkov, A. V., VEGA1 PLASMAG-1 PLASMA ENERGY ANALYSER DATA V1.0, VEGA1-C-PM1-2-RDR-HALLEY-V1.0, NASA Planetary Data System, 1997
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: VEGA 1 satellite PLASMAG instrument energy analyzer data from 1P/Halley
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: The PLASMAG-1 instument package included six different sensors: A0 plasma impact detector for measuring neutral particle flux, (manufactured by R. Grard, ESA/ESTEC, Noordwijk, The Netherlands) A1 Faraday cup for measuring integral ion flux from solar direction, A2 Faraday cup for measuring integral ion flux and neutral particles from ram direction, A3 spherical electrostatic analyzer for measuring ions from ram direction in the energy range of 15 eV - 3.6 keV in 120 logarithmically spaced channels, A4 spherical electrostatic analyzer for measuring ions from solar direction in the energy range of 60 eV - 30 keV in 60 logarithmically spaced channels, A5 cylindrical electrostatic analyzer for measuring ions perpendicular to the ecliptic plane in the energy range of 2 eV - 10 keV in 30 logarithmically spaced channels.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview =================
The PLASMAG-1 instument package included six different sensors: A0 plasma impact detector for measuring neutral particle flux, (manufactured by R. Grard, ESA/ESTEC, Noordwijk, The Netherlands) A1 Faraday cup for measuring integral ion flux from solar direction, A2 Faraday cup for measuring integral ion flux and neutral particles from ram direction, A3 spherical electrostatic analyzer for measuring ions from ram direction in the energy range of 15 eV - 3.6 keV in 120 logarithmically spaced channels, A4 spherical electrostatic analyzer for measuring ions from solar direction in the energy range of 60 eV - 30 keV in 60 logarithmically spaced channels, A5 cylindrical electrostatic analyzer for measuring ions perpendicular to the ecliptic plane in the energy range of 2 eV - 10 keV in 30 logarithmically spaced channels.
The sensitivity of the electron analyzer A5 was very low. Detectors A3 and A5 of Vega-1 were fatally damaged during the cruise phase.
Field of view of the detectors: A1: 90x90 deg (centered on solar direction), A2: 26x26 deg (centered on ram direction), A3: 32x12 deg (centered on ram direction), A4: 36x32 deg (centered on solar direction), A5: 7x7 deg (perpendicular to ecliptic plane).
Effective apperture: A1: 1.6 cm**2 A2: 0.93 cm**2 A3: 0.0193 cm**2 A4: 0.00455 cm**2 A5: 0.0036 cm**2
Energy resolution: A3: 3.2 % A4: 3.85% A5: 7.5 %
One complete spectrum was taken by A3, A4, and A5 in every second during the BRL (high telemery rate) seance. Sampling times for each energy channel: A3: 0.005 sec A4: 0.005 sec A5: 0.021 sec
During the cruise phase data were recorded by an on-board magnetometer at lower telemetry rate.
The data were measured during the BRL seance on March 6, 1986.
1. parameter: time in sec - end of a 10 sec averaging interval (0 sec is 4:00 UT in spacecraft time) 2-60. parameters: count rates observed by A4 (ions from solar direction)
The energy levels for the 59 channels of detector A4 in eV:
70.4 75.7 87.1 90.6 101.2 113.5 123.2 131.6 150.5 167 2 183.0 204.2 226.2 253.4 281.6 308.0 341.4 380.2 423.3 471 7 522.7 583.4 650.3 722.5 799.0 887.9 988.2 1103.5 1223.2 1360 5 1511.8 1672.9 1859.4 2074.2 2289.8 2556.4 2824.8 3147.8 3497.1 3899 3 4331.4 4842.6 5380.3 6000.7 6651.0 7302.2 8132.1 9081.6 10137.6 11308 0 12496.0 13921.6 15576.0 17344.8 19228.0 21348.8 23830.4 26435.2 29515.2
Measurements were performed in every sec, data provided here are 10 sec averages.
Time of first observation: 4:17:29 UT Time of first data in file: 4:17:38 UT (1058 sec) Time of last observation: 8:25:08 UT Time of last data in file: 8:25:08 UT (15908 sec) There was no longer data gap than a few seconds. Missing or bad data: -999
